title: Analyst Reveals What Will Trigger The Largest XRP Price Rally In History
body: Excitement is growing in the crypto community as analysts predict an explosive move for the XRP price in the coming weeks. With signs of progress emerging from the US regarding the government shutdown , analysts are closely watching to see if political developments could be the spark that elevates XRP from its recent downturn and pushes it to new price levels. US Government Reopening To Trigger XRP Price Rally Levi Rietveld, a well-known crypto analyst on X social media, stated in a post on November 8 that he expects the largest XRP rally in history to occur once the US government shutdown comes to an end. His prediction has garnered significant attention and triggered discussions across the crypto community, as XRP investors start to connect the impact of political stability with digital asset performance. Market analyst, Steph Crypto, also shares the same view. In an X post on November 9, he pointed out that US President Donald Trump has been urging both the Democratic and Republican parties to reach a deal to end the shutdown. The analyst forecasts that once the government reopens, XRP and other cryptocurrencies are likely to experience a significant breakout. Steph is Crypto also reminded XRP holders and community members that when the last government shutdown ended in 2019 , the XRP price rose by more than 70%. He further hinted that history could repeat itself in this bull cycle under similar political conditions. New reports show that several Senate Democrats have joined Republicans to move forward with a bipartisan plan to open the government after 40 days of closure. This is the first real progress seen in weeks, signaling a potential end to the prolonged stalemate. However, the proposal still needs to pass the House before any official reopening can occur. For now, traders remain on edge, closely watching how developments in Washington will play out. The uncertainty surrounding the shutdown has already begun weighing down on the crypto market , with investors bracing for volatility across XRP, Bitcoin, and other cryptocurrencies. The longer the government shutdown lasts, the more pressure could build on risk assets. XRP Targets $10 On Bull Flag Formation On the technical side, crypto analyst Ali Martinez has noted that the XRP price could be gearing up for a parabolic surge to uncharted territories soon. He shared a detailed chart that shows the cryptocurrency forming a potential Bull Flag pattern on the monthly timeframe. Martinez explained that if this pattern plays out completely, XRP could initially decline by about 22.45% to $1.90 before starting a major rally all the way up to $10. Currently, the cryptocurrency is trading at $2.45, meaning a surge to this double-digit level would represent a significant 308% increase. The analyst‚Äôs chart shows a clear resistance near $3.5, which, if broken, could open the door for the XRP price‚Äôs projected explosive move upward.

title: 5 Things That Will Transform Digital Asset Space in 2026 ‚Äì Zodia Custody Report
body: 2026 is the year digital assets will ‚Äúgrow up,‚Äù says Zodia Custody‚Äôs 2026 predictions report . The Standard Chartered -backed digital asset custodian looked into custody, collateral, and connectivity as the rising backbone of ‚Äúmarket infrastructure.‚Äù At the same time, stablecoins, staking, and tokenisation are opening up capital efficiency for institutions globally, they said. Building Blocks of a New Market Architecture According to Anoosh Arevshatian, Chief Product Officer at Zodia Custody, as 2026 approaches, the company is seeing a clear theme. ‚ÄúInstitutional digital assets are moving from possibility to productivity,‚Äù she claims. ‚ÄúWe are no longer talking about pilots or proofs of concept, we are talking about infrastructure.‚Äù Notably, the report argues: custody will become critical market infrastructure for institutional digital asset activities; stablecoins and tokenised funds will become liquidity foundations; staking and DeFi will grow into institutional yield engines; collateral will redefine capital efficiency. Per Arevshatian, ‚ÄúAs 2026 approaches, one theme is becoming clear: 2026 will not be defined by speculation or proof of concepts, but by execution and productivity. Institutions will focus on interoperability, trust, and capital efficiency, and digital asset infrastructure will gradually drive payments, clearing, and settlement as part of the world‚Äôs financial backbone.‚Äù Zodia Custody‚Äôs clients and partners showcase a shift from experimentation to execution, the executive says. They are looking towards a future of finance that is digital, as well as governed, interoperable, and trusted. ‚ÄúCustody, settlement, staking, tokenisation, stablecoins ‚Äì these are no longer fringe innovations; they are the building blocks of a new market architecture,‚Äù Arevshatian concludes. You may also like: Japan‚Äôs FSA Weighs New Registration Rules for Crypto Custodians and Service Providers Gold futures surged past $4,000 per ounce on Monday as the U.S. Senate advanced a bipartisan deal to end the 40-day government shutdown.Meanwhile, Bitcoin jumped from $100,000 to around $106,000, driven by expectations that reopening the federal government indicates a return to deficit spending and monetary expansion.The breakthrough came after eight Democratic senators crossed party lines to support a compromise that would reopen federal operations through January, reverse... Five Things to Watch in 2026 Digital Asset Space Zodia Custody‚Äôs report lists five key elements to keep an eye on this upcoming year. 1. Custody matures into critical infrastructure This, says the report is a crucial move as it forms ‚Äúthe key orchestration layer needed to unlock digital asset activities.‚Äù Custody is ‚Äúthe operational core of institutional adoption; the infrastructure upon which everything else runs.‚Äù Custody will no longer be a service, but a system, with compliance, risk, and operational resilience. Regulators will work on global digital custodian standards, rising use cases will lead to digital asset custodians, institutions will adopt multi-custodian models, and custodians will partner up to expand ecosystem connectivity for end users. Deborah Algeo Managing Director, Solutions, commented that, by 2026, ‚Äúbanks will treat digital-asset infrastructure like cloud computing ‚Äì critical to operations, but not something to reinvent. Sub custody, white-label, and SaaS solutions will become the fastest, safest route to market.‚Äù Moreover, Jay Tan, Product Innovation & Advisory Specialist, argued that custody will be ‚Äútreated as critical financial market infrastructure ‚Äì as fundamental as payments or clearing.‚Äù ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre seeing regulators and clients align around one clear idea: custody isn‚Äôt just safekeeping, it‚Äôs market infrastructure. By 2026, I expect board-level policies to mandate multiple custodians and continuous compliance evidence by default. The winners will be those who make regulatory conformity effortless, embedding compliance and security by design,‚Äù Tan wrote. Meanwhile, the company is a Canton Foundation member, describing the Canton Network is a ‚Äònetwork of networks‚Äô for institutional custody. From tokenisation to settlement, the Canton Network is redefining how regulated institutions operate on blockchain, combining privacy, scalability, and interoperability in a single, public, institution-ready network. In our latest episode of¬†Zodia Custody Industry Insights, our‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/SYARoSDQ9h ‚Äî Zodia (@ZodiaCustody) October 28, 2025 2. Stablecoins evolve into liquidity engines In 2026, stablecoins will not be just settlement tokens, but also programmable treasury tools. Safe and compliant stablecoin infrastructure and global regulatory clarity will boost the ecosystem and the rise of bank-issued and institutional-grade stablecoins. Moreover, stablecoin treasuries will provide 24/7 liquidity, automated payments, and yield-bearing strategies. ‚ÄúThe line between cash, collateral, and yield-bearing assets will continue to blur,‚Äù the report argues. According to Kelly Lai, Head of Product Innovation & Advisory, stablecoins are ‚Äúno longer a crypto convenience, they‚Äôre the connective tissue of institutional finance. For banks, asset managers, and corporates, they offer what legacy systems can‚Äôt: real-time liquidity, programmable control, and transparent backing.‚Äù 3. Collateral moves in real time Next year will see digital-asset collateral unlocking ‚Äútrillions in idle capital,‚Äù Zodia Custody says. The growth of real-time margining and settlement will improve transparency but also compress capital cycles. Notably, the experts expect regulators to recognize tokenised assets as eligible collateral, and tokenised money market funds and RWAs to enter collateral pools. ‚ÄúCustody and collateral will merge into one dynamic ecosystem, where capital is always safe, yet always working,‚Äù says the report. ‚ÄúCollateral is the quiet force that powers capital markets, and digital assets are rewriting its playbook. As controls, regulation, and confidence mature, what started as cautious experimentation will become systemic change. Slowly, then suddenly,‚Äù argues Steven Taylor, Strategic Product Development. 4. Staking and DeFi become yield infrastructure Per the report, staking will shift from ‚Äúan optional activity to a default feature of digital asset custody.‚Äù At the same time, permissioned DeFi vaults will provide regulated access to decentralised yield, with yield being rebuilt as transparent, programmable, and on-chain. Insitutional yield will enter a novel phase with safe connectivity to vetted DeFi and staking networks. Finally, tokenised funds and on-chain credit pools will integrate with custody workflows. Nezhda Aliyeva Head of Product, argued that staking will no longer be a niche yield strategy. Rather, it will be ‚Äúan operational necessity for institutions seeking compliant, risk-adjusted returns on digital assets.‚Äù Therefore, institutional staking is already moving from ‚Äúexperiment to expectation.‚Äù Clients want yield, but one provided as other financial operations: segregated, secure, and compliant. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs why we‚Äôre building staking not as an add-on, but as an integrated capability within custody itself,‚Äù Aliyeva said. Also, Sahil Sood, Product Innovation & Advisory Specialist, highlighted that the company is seeing ‚Äúa convergence of institutional liquidity with DeFi pools, unlocking fascinating new use-cases, from looping strategies with tokenised RWAs to hybrid borrow/lend models that combine DeFi liquidity with centralised collateral.‚Äù Sood continued: ‚ÄúProtocols like Morpho are proving that risk-managed DeFi can deliver compelling yields and transparency. By 2026, private DeFi vaults and permissioned markets will be core products for institutions.‚Äù 5. Tokenised assets go mainstream The report admitted that this has been predicted many times before. However, the situation is different in 2026, it argues. Notably, the market has seen its infrastructure and tooling improve, tokenised commodities recorded record inflows, and money market funds and short-term credit instruments, among others, are issued, traded, and collateralised on-chain. Custody and collateral infrastructure will make tokenised assets as seamless and secure, while compliant tooling will provide KYC and on-chain identity solutions that will result in institutions treating tokenised funds as digital cash equivalents. They will earn yield while remaining compliant. Finally, ‚ÄúIn 2026, capital efficiency ‚Äì not speculation ‚Äì will define the institutional digital asset era. Off-exchange settlement (OES) will be the gateway that makes it safe, compliant, and scalable,‚Äù says Wing Cheah, Head of Product, Interchange. ‚ÄúInstitutions aren‚Äôt chasing speculation; they‚Äôre chasing capital efficiency. Off-exchange settlement delivers that by putting custody and control back where they belong. As tokenised collateral and regulated venues converge, OES will become the default workflow for serious institutional participation,‚Äù Cheah concludes. You may also like: Australia Risks Being ‚ÄòLeft Behind‚Äô as Tokenization Transforms Global Markets ‚Äì ASIC Australia‚Äôs financial regulator has warned that the country risks falling behind as blockchain-driven tokenization reshapes global markets, urging swift action to modernize regulations and embrace innovation.Speaking at the National Press Club in Canberra on November 5, Australian Securities and Investments Commission (ASIC) Chair Joe Longo said tokenization, the process of turning real-world assets into digital tokens, is transforming capital markets worldwide.He cautioned that... The post 5 Things That Will Transform Digital Asset Space in 2026 ‚Äì Zodia Custody Report appeared first on Cryptonews .

title: Malicious VS Code extensions resurface, stealing GitHub credentials and crypto wallets
body: Developers will have to contend with a dormant turned active malicious code on Visual Studio Code (VS Code) extensions, which is believed to have compromised thousands of users by stealing credentials for GitHub, Open VSX, and cryptocurrency wallets. Operation GlassWorm, first identified by cybersecurity firm Koi Security late last month, was created by a group hacking VS Code extensions distributed through both the Open VSX Registry and Microsoft‚Äôs Visual Studio Marketplace. The bad actors have reportedly been embedding invisible malicious code within legitimate-looking developer tools. Koi security researchers say the campaign is mainly to harvest developer credentials like NPM tokens, GitHub logins, and Git credentials, to enable supply chain compromise and financial theft. According to Koi‚Äôs analysis, the same malware has also targeted 49 different cryptocurrency wallet extensions, draining user funds and exfiltrating sensitive data to remote servers. GlassWorm turns developer machines into criminals‚Äô aid As reported by Koi‚Äôs team blog article shared on several subreddits, the malicious extensions deploy SOCKS proxy servers and use the compromised developer systems to build up a criminal proxy network. In parallel, they install hidden VNC servers, giving attackers full remote access to victim machines without visible indicators. Stolen GitHub and NPM credentials help the operators infect additional repositories and packages, and allow GlassWorm to propagate deeper into the software supply chain. Open VSX confirmed it had identified and removed all known malicious extensions associated with the campaign on October 21, also revoking and rotating compromised tokens. However, Koi Security‚Äôs new report indicates that GlassWorm has resurfaced, using a more advanced form of Unicode-based obfuscation to bypass detection systems. According to the company, seven extensions were compromised again on October 17, amassing a combined 35,800 downloads. Koi‚Äôs telemetry also shows that ten infected extensions are currently active and publicly available, and distribute malware as of this writing. ‚ÄúThe attacker‚Äôs command-and-control infrastructure remains fully operational. Payload servers are still responding, and stolen credentials are being used to compromise new packages.‚Äù CodeJoy malware is invincible, Koi security debunks Koi‚Äôs risk analysis engine flagged an Open VSX extension called CodeJoy after version 1.8.3 exhibited ‚Äúunusual behavioral changes.‚Äù CodeJoy looks like a legitimate developer productivity tool with hundreds of downloads, a clean codebase, and regular updates. ‚ÄúWhen we opened the source code, we noticed a massive gap between lines two and seven,‚Äù Koi researchers said. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs not empty space, it‚Äôs malicious code encoded in unprintable Unicode characters that don‚Äôt render in your code editor.‚Äù CodeJoy invincible code. Source: Koi Research The attackers used invincible Unicode variation selectors that make the malicious payload invisible to the human eye. Static analysis tools and manual code reviews saw nothing unusual, yet the JavaScript interpreter executed the hidden commands flawlessly. When decoded, the invisible characters revealed a second-stage payload mechanism, one that Koi researchers discovered uses the Solana blockchain as its command-and-control (C2) infrastructure. ‚ÄúThe attacker is using a public blockchain, which is immutable, decentralized, and censorship-resistant, as their C2 channel,‚Äù Koi explained. The malware scans the Solana network for transactions from a hardcoded wallet address. Upon finding one, it reads the memo field, where arbitrary text can be attached to transactions. Inside that memo field lies a JSON object containing a base64-encoded link to download the next-stage payload. A Solana transaction from October 15 displayed in Koi‚Äôs analysis contained data that was decoded to a URL hosting the active location for downloading the next stage of the malware. An attacker can rotate payloads by posting a new Solana transaction for fractions of a cent, updating all infected extensions that query the blockchain for new instructions. Per Koi, even if defenders block one payload URL, the attacker can issue another transaction faster than it takes to bring one down. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs like playing whack-a-mole with infinite moles,‚Äù a Koi researcher noted. Koi Security members Idan Dardikman, Yuval Ronen, and Lotan Sery confirmed that the threat actor has posted fresh Solana transactions containing new command endpoints as recently as this week. title: Crucial Breakthrough: House Speaker Confirms Stopgap Budget Votes Secured
body: BitcoinWorld Crucial Breakthrough: House Speaker Confirms Stopgap Budget Votes Secured In a significant political development that could avert a government shutdown, House Speaker Mike Johnson has announced he believes he has secured the necessary votes to pass a critical stopgap budget measure. This breakthrough comes after weeks of intense negotiations and uncertainty about federal funding. What Does This Stopgap Budget Mean for Americans? The stopgap budget represents a temporary funding solution that would keep government agencies operational while lawmakers continue working on a comprehensive spending package. This approach prevents what could have been a disruptive government shutdown affecting millions of Americans. Speaker Johnson expressed confidence in the vote count during a press conference, stating that bipartisan support has been secured for this essential measure. The stopgap budget would maintain current funding levels for all federal operations. Why Is This Stopgap Budget Vote So Important? Without this temporary funding measure, the federal government would face a partial shutdown that could: Disrupt essential services across multiple agencies Affect federal employee paychecks and operations Impact economic stability and market confidence Delay critical government functions and services The successful passage of this stopgap budget would provide lawmakers with additional time to negotiate a more comprehensive, long-term spending agreement. How Did Speaker Johnson Secure the Necessary Support? Securing votes for the stopgap budget required careful negotiation and compromise. The Speaker worked across party lines to address concerns from various factions within Congress. Key elements that helped build consensus include: Maintaining current funding levels without controversial policy riders Providing a reasonable timeframe for continued negotiations Addressing urgent priorities from both parties Ensuring essential government services remain uninterrupted What Happens Next With the Stopgap Budget? With the House vote apparently secured, the stopgap budget will move to the Senate for consideration. If passed by both chambers, the measure would then go to the President for signature. This temporary solution would typically fund the government for several weeks while comprehensive budget talks continue. The successful advancement of this stopgap budget demonstrates that despite political differences, lawmakers can find common ground on essential governance matters. However, the real challenge remains reaching agreement on a full-year budget that addresses the nation‚Äôs priorities. Conclusion: A Temporary Solution With Lasting Implications Speaker Johnson‚Äôs confidence in having the votes for the stopgap budget represents a crucial step toward maintaining government stability. While this temporary measure addresses immediate funding needs, it underscores the ongoing challenges in reaching bipartisan consensus on long-term fiscal policy. The successful passage of this stopgap budget would provide breathing room for more substantive negotiations while ensuring continuity in government services that millions of Americans depend on daily. Frequently Asked Questions What is a stopgap budget? A stopgap budget is a temporary funding measure that keeps the government operating when Congress hasn‚Äôt passed full-year appropriations bills by the deadline. How long does a stopgap budget typically last? Stopgap budgets usually fund the government for several weeks to a few months, giving lawmakers additional time to negotiate comprehensive spending legislation. What happens if the stopgap budget isn‚Äôt passed? Without a stopgap budget or full-year funding, the federal government would partially shut down, forcing non-essential services to close and furloughing many federal employees. Can the stopgap budget include policy changes? Typically, stopgap budgets maintain existing funding levels and policies to ensure quick passage, though sometimes they include limited, urgent adjustments. How does this affect federal workers? A passed stopgap budget ensures federal employees continue receiving paychecks and government services operate normally. What‚Äôs the difference between a stopgap budget and a full budget? A stopgap budget is temporary and maintains current funding, while a full budget sets new spending priorities and policies for the entire fiscal year. Found this breakdown of the stopgap budget situation helpful? Share this article with others who need to understand this critical government funding development! To learn more about the latest government funding trends, explore our article on key developments shaping federal budget negotiations and economic implications. This post Crucial Breakthrough: House Speaker Confirms Stopgap Budget Votes Secured first appeared on BitcoinWorld .

title: eToro's Big Buyback And Bold Growth Moves Haven't Won Over The Market Yet
body: Summary eToro Group Ltd. continues to grow users and revenue, but the stock remains pressured due to thin profit margins and heavy reliance on crypto trading. ETOR stock's valuation appears fair, trading at 15x forward earnings and just over 2x book value, with potential upside if profits stabilize and diversify. Management's $150 million buyback and expansion into new products and markets signal confidence, but competition and regulatory risks remain high. I remain neutral on ETOR, recommending a Hold; wait for steadier profits and less dependence on crypto before considering a Buy rating. Looking back at where I stood on eToro Group Ltd. ( ETOR ) in September , when the price sat around $44, things haven‚Äôt exactly gotten easier for this stock. It‚Äôs dropped another 20 percent and now sits just above $35 before the market opens, close to its recent lows. This is after a three-month period where shares lost nearly 40 percent, even though eToro keeps reporting strong results , just rolled out a big $150 million share buyback and keeps growing its user base and platform assets at a double-digit pace. The business itself is still running strong, maybe even picking up steam but it‚Äôs clear the market isn‚Äôt fully convinced yet. Even though eToro trades at about 15 times what it‚Äôs expected to earn in 2025 (and just over 2 times book value), its profit margins are pretty thin, just over 1 percent and it‚Äôs still tied closely to the unpredictable world of crypto trading. The company keeps launching new products and pushing into new markets, but it hasn‚Äôt really shown it can generate consistent profits. If management keeps doing a good job and the market feels better, I think there‚Äôs real room for the stock to rise but there‚Äôs also a lot of risk if crypto cools off or competitors step up. I think the market is right to be careful. ETOR is growing fast but the earnings are still bumpy. The stock looks fairly priced right now considering both the upside and the risk. So for now, this feels like something to wait and watch. So, I‚Äôd keep an eye on it but I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs time to jump in or sell. Business Highlights (ETOR Q3 2025 Shareholder Presentation) What eToro Is Building and Where Its Money Comes From eToro is a global trading platform where people can buy stocks, crypto, commodities and options and it stands out for its social copy-trading features plus a bunch of newer banking and wealth tools. Management has spent the past year rolling out 24/5 U.S. stock trading, launching tokenized assets , bringing in AI investing tools and pushing wealth products into more places. One move that stands out is the Spaceship acquisition in Australia, which bumped funded accounts up 16 percent to 3.73 million and helped eToro get a stronger foothold in the retirement savings market in Asia-Pacific. They‚Äôve also added a U.K. cash ISA and started offering more local banking features. All this should help them build up some steady income but the reality is that trading and especially crypto, is still the main event for eToro right now. They‚Äôre working hard to diversify but it‚Äôs still early days for those other lines of business. Four main areas drive eToro‚Äôs growth. (ETOR Q3 2025 Shareholder Presentation) Who eToro Competes With and What Could Change This space is wild. eToro‚Äôs in the thick of a fintech industry that‚Äôs full of competition and moving fast. Big names like Robinhood and Coinbase are stronger brands in the U.S., with deeper pockets and marketing spend and there are always new players trying to break in from all over the world. The way the industry‚Äôs changing is pretty interesting. You‚Äôve got the rise of tokenized assets, more people trading socially, these simple investing apps, a whole lot of regulatory headaches and the cost to attract new customers keeps climbing. What gives eToro a leg up is its global reach and social features, especially outside the U.S. In America, though, it‚Äôs still a small player and even around the world, it really depends on what everyday people do with their money. If trading is hot, eToro‚Äôs business booms but if things quiet down, so does revenue. There‚Äôs a real opportunity but there‚Äôs also the risk that what they offer just becomes one more thing you can get anywhere. Staying ahead means they‚Äôll need to keep coming up with new ideas and spend their money wisely, or they‚Äôll fall behind. New products and global expansion. (ETOR Q3 2025 Shareholder Presentation) What the Numbers Show In the third quarter of 2025, eToro pulled in $4.11 billion in revenue and net contribution rose 28 percent from last year to $215 million. Net income went up 48 percent to $57 million and adjusted EBITDA was up 43 percent to $78 million. Assets under administration shot up to $20.8 billion. The company really is growing: they have more funded accounts, more interest-earning assets and more money coming through the platform. Even so, margins are still pretty thin. Profit margins are just about 1.4 percent and the stock trades at about 15 times 2025 expected earnings. The thing is, since so much of their business depends on trading (especially crypto), profits are always going to jump around. They‚Äôve got over a billion dollars in cash and don‚Äôt have too much debt but they‚Äôre still putting a lot of money into new products and growth. If you look at what‚Äôs driving the business, crypto commissions grew a ton, equities are strong but income from other stuff isn‚Äôt a big deal yet. They‚Äôre trying to build up their banking, wealth and subscription businesses but for now, the ups and downs in crypto are what make the difference. I see lots of growth but the way they make money isn‚Äôt steady enough yet for me to say you should buy this. People need to see bigger and more steady profits, not just higher sales. Net Contribution Breakdown (ETOR Q3 2025 Shareholder Presentation) Is eToro Stock Cheap or Expensive? On valuation, eToro trades at about 15 times forward earnings and just over twice book value. It actually looks cheaper than Robinhood or Coinbase if you just look at P/E but those companies have different business models and way higher margins. eToro‚Äôs price-to-book isn‚Äôt scary but it feels like the market is waiting for proof that the profits will last. Unless they start showing steady improvement in margins or really shift their revenue mix, I just don‚Äôt see a reason the shares should re-rate higher soon. To me, the stock‚Äôs not especially cheap but not expensive either. It‚Äôs right in that zone where the potential and the risk pretty much cancel each other out. How the Market Feels About ETOR Lately When you read the headlines, you‚Äôd think things were going great: strong growth, a big buyback, new features, AI, tokenized assets, CopyTrader making its way into the U.S. But the stock‚Äôs been under pressure even after solid earnings, which tells me investors still have doubts about how stable those profits are. The buyback is a good sign that management thinks the shares are cheap but it also shows just how much eToro depends on the ups and downs of trading and how hard it is to make money from new launches right away. Investors are definitely paying attention to more than just the headline numbers; they want to see profits stick around and more steady income. So the news looks pretty positive but the stock isn‚Äôt moving, which means people want to see more proof before they get excited. eToro is buying back shares (ETOR Q3 2025 Shareholder Presentation) The Big Risks I‚Äôm Watching There are some real risks here and they aren‚Äôt just ‚Äúwhat if‚Äù scenarios. The biggest is that eToro still depends heavily on crypto trading volumes and prices, which, let‚Äôs face it, can swing wildly. There‚Äôs also fierce competition from all sides and with regulation constantly shifting around the world, eToro has to keep up with a maze of rules. The company is also betting big on new wealth and banking products and there‚Äôs no guarantee those take off. And with all these new ideas like AI-driven investing and tokenized assets, there‚Äôs always a chance they end up being flashy features that don‚Äôt bring in much cash. On top of all that, trying to grow so quickly and in so many places can stretch management thin. These are the main reasons I think it makes sense to hold the stock for now. Things could go really well if everything works out but there‚Äôs just as much risk if something goes wrong, especially with crypto or rules changing. What Could Happen Next Analysts are looking for good earnings growth, with EPS that could hit $2.47 next year and $2.90 the year after and revenue to top a billion by 2027. But for now, I think things will stay pretty bumpy. Trading activity and crypto sentiment are still the main drivers, so quarters could easily swing either way. What I‚Äôll be watching is whether eToro can make more progress in the U.S. with CopyTrader , grow those banking and wealth products and get people using tokenized assets and AI tools. A surprise to the upside could come if any of these new ideas really catch on fast but what investors really want to see is more stable, steady profits that aren‚Äôt so tied to what‚Äôs happening with crypto. The next year is all about how well they actually perform. If they can show they‚Äôre growing margins and making money from more than just trading, I think the shares could go up. Until then, I‚Äôm happy to just watch from the sidelines. Funded accounts keep increasing (ETOR Q3 2025 Shareholder Presentation) Where ETOR Stock Could Go From Here If things go south, say crypto trading slows and new products flop, then earnings per share could drop below $2 and the stock could break through those recent lows in the $30s. If things just muddle along, with solid growth but thin margins and earnings staying choppy, I‚Äôd expect the stock to hover somewhere between $35 and $50. On the bright side, if eToro really does actually branch out and make more money from new products while crypto stays strong, then EPS could hit $3 or more by 2027 and the stock might finally make a run above $55. What really matters is if the company can show a few quarters of steady growth from different areas. If they can do that, people‚Äôs views will change fast. But if crypto, new rules, or new products let people down, I could see shares heading lower in a hurry. Bottom Line: Why I‚Äôm Still on Hold All in all, I‚Äôm still neutral on ETOR at these prices. The company‚Äôs key numbers are headed the right way, management is showing some guts with the buyback and the long-term story still looks good if they can make trading less of a single-focus operation. But until they prove they can grow their profits and become less dependent on crypto, I think the market is smart to be careful. Right now, the chances for gains and losses seem about even. If you own ETOR already, it makes sense to hold on and see if they can make it work. If you‚Äôre thinking about buying in now, I‚Äôd wait until there‚Äôs better proof of steady profits or the stock gets cheaper. No need to rush in now. Let‚Äôs see how the next few quarters play out.

title: Coinbase to launch platform for pre-listing token sales
Fed Governor Predicts Multi-Trillion Dollar Stablecoin Boom Will Force Down US Interest Rates
body: A senior U.S. Federal Reserve official has warned that the explosive growth of stablecoins, dollar-pegged digital tokens now processing trillions of dollars in payments, could reshape global finance and exert long-term downward pressure on U.S. interest rates. In a speech titled ‚ÄúA Global Stablecoin Glut: Implications for Monetary Policy‚Äù delivered at the BCVC Summit 2025 in New York, Fed Governor Stephen I. Miran said the rising demand for stablecoins is likely to increase purchases of U.S. Treasury securities and other liquid dollar assets. pic.twitter.com/emAEeHwtq8 ‚Äî Stephen Miran (@SteveMiran) November 10, 2025 This, he argued, could mimic the effects of the early-2000s ‚Äúglobal savings glut‚Äù that depressed rates worldwide. ‚ÄúStablecoins may become a multitrillion-dollar elephant in the room for central bankers,‚Äù Miran said. ‚ÄúTheir growth increases the supply of loanable funds in the U.S. economy, placing downward pressure on the neutral interest rate.‚Äù Trillions in Stablecoins Could Lower Neutral Interest Rate by 40 Basis Points Miran‚Äôs comments come as the Federal Reserve maintains a target range of 3.75% to 4.00% for the federal funds rate, following two cuts this year. Bitcoin slipped under $110K after the Fed‚Äôs 25 bp rate cut, as Powell‚Äôs cautious tone and data blackout from the US shutdown left traders uncertain about what comes next. #bitcoin #FedRateCut https://t.co/uMaGFrSKl8 ‚Äî Cryptonews.com (@cryptonews) October 30, 2025 The effective rate currently sits around 3.87%, marking a decline from 4.33% earlier in 2025. The Fed governor‚Äôs analysis suggests that even without further rate cuts, the rapid adoption of stablecoins could naturally exert downward pressure on borrowing costs. By attracting trillions in reserves into dollar-backed digital assets, much of it from outside the U.S., stablecoins effectively expand the pool of funds available for lending, similar to how global capital inflows once helped keep yields low in the 2000s. According to Miran, the rise of stablecoins could lower the neutral interest rate, the level at which monetary policy is neither stimulating nor restricting the economy, by as much as 40 basis points if adoption projections materialize. Under the new GENIUS Act , passed earlier this year, U.S. stablecoin issuers must hold reserves fully backed by safe, liquid dollar assets such as Treasury bills, repos, and government money market funds. This mandate, Miran said, could substantially boost demand for U.S. debt. The Fed estimates that the stablecoin market could grow to between $1 trillion and $3 trillion by 2030, rivaling the scale of quantitative easing programs from the COVID-19 era. According to Andreessen Horowitz‚Äôs ‚ÄúState of Crypto 2025‚Äù report, stablecoins processed $46 trillion in transactions over the past year , a 106% increase from 2024, and now rival the U.S. Automated Clearing House (ACH) in payment volume. Stablecoins moved $9 trillion in payments last year, over half of Visa‚Äôs volume and 5√ó PayPal‚Äôs, a surge A16z says marks crypto‚Äôs real-world breakout. #Stablecoins #StateofCrypto https://t.co/tltfN72grP ‚Äî Cryptonews.com (@cryptonews) October 23, 2025 Collectively, stablecoin reserves hold over $150 billion in U.S. Treasuries, making them the 17th largest holder of American debt, ahead of several sovereign nations. Stablecoins Now Represent Over 1% of U.S. Dollars in Circulation, Reshaping Global Finance Miran compared the rise of stablecoins to the early-2000s ‚Äúglobal savings glut,‚Äù which saw an influx of foreign capital into U.S. debt markets, driving down yields. The effect, he warned, could be similar: more savings chasing safe dollar assets, reducing the equilibrium or ‚Äúneutral‚Äù interest rate. Economists Marina Azzimonti and Vincenzo Quadrini previously estimated that widespread stablecoin adoption could push rates down by as much as 40 basis points. If accurate, that shift could mean the Fed would need to keep policy rates lower than they otherwise would to maintain economic balance. Miran cautioned that if the Fed failed to adjust to a lower rate, monetary policy could become ‚Äúunintentionally contractionary.‚Äù Once seen as a niche instrument for crypto trading, stablecoins have become one of the largest digital payment systems in the world. Transfers settle in seconds, cost less than a cent, and are increasingly used for remittances, cross-border trade, and decentralized finance (DeFi) activity. Data from A16z shows that more than 1% of all U.S. dollars in circulation now exist in tokenized form on public blockchains, a milestone that underscores how digital dollars are reshaping global finance. The post Fed Governor Predicts Multi-Trillion Dollar Stablecoin Boom Will Force Down US Interest Rates appeared first on Cryptonews .

title: Ripple CEO Brad Garlinghouse Makes Important Statements About XRP! "We Will Not Support These!"
body: Ripple and XRP, which emerged victorious from their legal battle with the SEC and achieved a major victory, continue to grow. At this point, while Ripple is frequently mentioned with new partnerships, US spot ETFs for XRP are expected to begin trading this week. While XRP and Ripple are gaining good momentum, important statements came from Ripple CEO Brad Garlinghouse. Accordingly, Brad Garlinghouse said that Ripple will not support any legislation that risks eliminating or jeopardizing the legal clarity and transparency that XRP currently provides in the US. Speaking in an interview with Crypto In America, Garlinghouse described XRP‚Äôs regulatory position as a milestone won through years of legal battles. The famous CEO said that Ripple will not allow XRP to be compromised. Garlinghouse also noted that XRP is now in a unique position after a US federal court ruled that XRP is not a security. He added that although the court decision is thought to provide clarity specifically for XRP, this clarity benefits not only XRP and Ripple, but the entire crypto industry. At this point, Garlinghouse stated that Ripple will not accept or support any bill that would pose a risk to XRP's current legal status. ‚ÄúRipple is in a unique position. XRP has clarity. We already have a federal court that said XRP is not a security, so why would we support something that challenges or blocks that?‚Äù *This is not investment advice. SUI Group partners with Bluefin to accelerate institutional adoption of crypto products
body: SUI Group, the pioneering publicly traded entity aligned with the Sui Foundation, has formed a strategic alliance with Bluefin, the foremost decentralized exchange on the Sui blockchain. The collaboration eyes tapping into Bluefin‚Äôs platform to expand access to digital asset products for institutions, and comes amid increased traction for crypto adoption across Wall Street. Sui‚Äôs native token could benefit from this traction. However, it traded near $2.16 support area amid recent sell-off pressure. Sui Group partners with Bluefin The centre of this partnership lies in SUI Group‚Äôs commitment to lend 2 million SUI tokens to Bluefin, bolstering the platform‚Äôs liquidity and operational capacity. Key to the strategic integration is more than the need for on-chain growth ‚Äì it targets institutional-grade infrastructure within the Sui ecosystem. Bluefin, which is backed by heavyweight investors such as Polychain, Brevan Howard Digital, Susquehanna, and Tower Research, has demonstrated robust growth since its inception. ‚ÄúThis partnership extends beyond capital ‚Äî we are looking to build the bridge from Wall Street to SUI,‚Äù said Marius Barnett, chairman of SUI Group. ‚ÄúThis model is aimed at enabling SUIG shareholders to benefit directly from the acceleration of institutional SUI trading and liquidity and creating a differentiated and recurring value stream as adoption scales. We are proud to partner with the Bluefin team to build a differentiated trading experience on-chain and drive the long-term growth of the Sui ecosystem. This agreement demonstrates SUIG‚Äôs ability to provide liquidity into the ecosystem and drive adoption with leading partners.‚Äù Unlocking institutional-grade opportunities on Sui Bluefin and Sui Group are looking to use this collaboration to address longstanding barriers to blockchain adoption in institutional circles. The two firms‚Äô eyes are on Wall Street‚Äôs embrace of onchain finance. In this case, Bluefin‚Äôs protocol, engineered for high-throughput decentralised trading, unifies perpetuals, spot markets, lending, and Vaults into a seamless interface. Bluefin, which first launched its perpetuals on the Sui blockchain in Q4 2023, surpassed $80 billion in cumulative trading volume. The platform launched its Bluefin Pro as it aimed for further adoption. The platform will tap into Sui‚Äôs high-performance architecture that provides a scalable foundation to expand its footprint. Zabi Mohebzada, Co-Founder of Bluefin, captured the synergy: ‚ÄúPartnering with SUI Group is a milestone in our mission to make on-chain markets accessible to the world. SUI Group understands both the culture of crypto-native innovation and the demands of institutional market participants. Their connectivity, credibility, and belief in open financial systems make them the ideal partner to scale both Bluefin and the Sui ecosystem.‚Äù Global markets are bullish overall amid regulatory evolution. It means initiatives like this could redefine how institutions engage with digital assets. That becomes even more supported when players prioritise institutional needs but do so without compromising decentralization. SUI Group and Bluefin are taking this route to not just accelerate adoption but architect the next era of on-chain finance. title: Brazil Central Bank unveils crypto rules to tighten oversight and curb illicit use
body: On‚ÄÇMonday, Brazil‚Äôs central bank announced the awaited regulations regarding trade and use of cryptocurrencies and other virtual assets. The new rules effectively apply the country¬¥s anti-money laundering and counter-terrorism financing standards to virtual-asset service providers, which is an important milestone in the application of Brazil‚Äôs crypto law of 2022. Although Brazil had approved its‚ÄÇcrypto legal framework almost three years ago, full enforcement depended on regulations from the central bank, which were to be complementary to the law. Last year,‚ÄÇthe monetary authority held four sets of public consultations to fine-tune the framework. The set of rules was made public at a time when the use of cryptocurrencies across Brazil is soaring, with stablecoins, or digital tokens‚ÄÇsupported by real-world assets such as the US dollar, leading the way. Central bank governor Gabriel Galipolo said in August that such instruments are often linked to illegal activities and employed to evade formal financial supervision. Rules take effect in February The new legislation will go into effect in February and will apply to a wide variety of financial players, including foreign exchange and securities brokers, distributors, and virtual asset service providers. According to the central bank‚Äôs official announcement, these firms will now need to get specific authorisation to function under the amended compliance framework. The central bank stated that the guidelines seek to fix regulatory gaps that have allowed some virtual-asset platforms to operate with little oversight. Policymakers hope that linking cryptocurrency service providers with existing financial-sector rules will prevent fraud, scams, and the use of virtual assets for illegal reasons. ‚ÄúThe new rules will reduce the scope for scams, fraud, and the use of virtual asset markets for money laundering,‚Äù said Gilneu Vivan, the bank‚Äôs director of regulation, during a press conference announcing the measures. Stablecoins in the spotlight Brazilian regulators‚ÄÇhave singled out stablecoins for particular scrutiny. In comparison, cryptos like Bitcoin are mostly regarded as investment‚ÄÇgoods, while stablecoins are placed on average when it comes to payments, providing users with a faster and less expensive alternative to traditional banking channels. Policymakers pointed out that the stability of these tokens with respect to fiat currencies makes them attractive for‚ÄÇcross-border transfers and even everyday purchases. But they have also been used to evade‚ÄÇtaxes and bookkeeping rules. The new forex‚ÄÇregulations place any purchase, sale, or exchange of virtual assets pegged to fiat currency under the classification of a foreign exchange operation. Also, the same categorisation applies to international payments or transfers‚ÄÇwith the use of virtual assets, including settlements of obligations through cards and electronic payment tools. Expanding consumer and compliance protections Apart from the foreign-exchange aspect, the‚ÄÇregulation also brings virtual-asset activity within the scope of Brazil‚Äôs general financial protections. The rules expand pre-existing‚ÄÇstandards around consumer protection, transparency, anti-money-laundering, and counter-terrorism financing to the crypto industry. New governance and security obligations will also‚ÄÇfall to service providers. Such requirements encompass internal controls, incident reporting, and compliance mechanisms that are consistent‚ÄÇwith those imposed upon traditional financial institutions. The introduction of the framework illustrates the‚ÄÇincreasing influence of the central bank on Brazil‚Äôs future financial ecosystem. Setting explicit definitions and operational borders is hoped to stimulate‚ÄÇinnovation while reducing the blight of the growing virtual-asset market. Industry stakeholders have less than three months to comply with the new supply chain criteria before the February deadline. Brazil is taking steps to regulate the rapidly growing domestic crypto market, which has the potential to be a lucrative part of digital finance, to mitigate volatility and dangers. The post Brazil Central Bank unveils crypto rules to tighten oversight and curb illicit use appeared first on Invezz

title: Here‚Äôs why Citi says crypto prices have been weak recently
ChatGPT-5 picks 3 cryptos to buy with your $2,000 tariff check
body: President Donald Trump announced on Sunday, November 9, that most U.S. citizens would receive ‚Äúat least‚Äù $2,000 in payments funded by revenue from his sweeping tariff program. The president‚Äôs tariff policy, which levies steep import fees on countries such as the U.K., Japan, and South Korea, has so far funneled roughly $195 billion. Accordingly, Trump argues that this revenue can bankroll a national ‚Äúdividend,‚Äù effectively a stimulus check for American households. As the crypto industry is emerging as one of the sectors most positively affected by these and similar macroeconomic developments , Finbold consulted OpenAI‚Äôs leading large language model (LLM), ChatGPT -5, regarding the top 3 cryptos to buy with your $2,000 tariff check. Bitcoin (BTC) Bitcoin ( BTC ) remains the flagship crypto by market cap, enjoying wide acceptance and the most positive mainstream sentiment as the ‚Äúdigital gold‚Äù or a hedge against macro uncertainty. What‚Äôs more, it‚Äôs rebounding on Monday , November 10, climbing back to $104,880 at the time of writing after its plunge below $100,000 last week. BTC 1-day price. Source: Finbold Given the asset‚Äôs positive reaction to ongoing tariff discussion, trade policy shifts, and likely cessation of the government shutdown, ChatGPT suggests its appeal as a store of value could go up in the weeks to come. Accordingly, the AI claims it would dedicate at least half of the $2,000 check to Bitcoin. Nonetheless, it noted that while Bitcoin is ‚Äúrelatively‚Äù more stable than most altcoins, it still swings violently, as evidenced by the largely disappointing ‚ÄúUptober‚Äù season. Ethereum (ETH) Currently trading at $3,546, Ethereum ( ETH ) stands out as the foundation of most decentralized finance ( DeFi ), smart contracts, and Web3 infrastructure. ETH 1-day price. Source: Finbold As Ethereum continues to evolve, ChatGPT predicts its role in Web3 is going to solidify. However, the algorithm noted that competing layer-1 blockchains ( L1s ) or scaling issues could reduce Ethereum‚Äôs dominance. That is, the ecosystem‚Äôs success will depend on developer adoption, regulatory clarity, infrastructure rollouts, and sustained institutional flows. This somewhat agrees with some technical indicators, such as the Rainbow Chart , which suggests that Ethereum might very well be up for a volatile short-term period. Therefore, the LLM argues that a sum between $600‚Äì$800 would be a solid bet on ETH for investors who are seeking long-term growth and infrastructure play but are willing to take a bet. Solana (SOL) The third pick, Solana ( SOL ), is up 3% on the daily chart at the time of writing, trading at $166.28. SOL 1-day price. Source: Finbold Elaborating on its choice, ChatGPT noted that Solana is often cited among the fastest-growing major blockchains in 2025, known for high throughput and low fees. As such, it is arguably a good pick for traders willing to accept higher risk for higher potential return. Still, while the AI added that SOL might offer more upside compared to BTC and ETH, it remains riskier following previous congestion and technical issues. Thus, the chatbot suggested that only $200‚Äì$400 of your $2,000 fund should go into SOL as a ‚Äúgrowth bet.‚Äù All in all, ChatGPT suggested a conservative approach when spending your $2,000 ‚Äútariff dividend ,‚Äù choosing Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Solana as the most ideal picks. Top 3 cryptos to buy with your $2,000 tariff check. Source: Finbold and ChatGPT These three assets, based on the previous discussion, offer a mix of stability, exposure to a vast area of the crypto infrastructure, and a chance to place a growth bet. title: WEFT Token 2.0 Launch: New Investors Invited to Join the Growing iGaming Ecosystem
This $0.035 Token Feels Like Cardano‚Äôs (ADA) Early Big Run. Is it the Next Crypto to Explode?

Amid the search by analysts, veterans, or enthusiasts for the next big cryptocurrency, the strong showing of MUTM during its presale, combined with its innovation roadmap, indicates that the altcoin may just be primed for the same type of breakout. title: Dogecoin Price Could See 4,440% Rally To $5 If This Macro Cycle Repeats
body: Crypto analyst Bitcoinsensus has predicted that the Dogecoin price could rally 4,400% to $5, a new all-time high (ATH) for the foremost meme coin. The analyst also revealed what needs to happen for DOGE to witness this parabolic rally. Dogecoin Price Eyes 4,400% Rally To $5 In an X post, the crypto analyst shared an accompanying chart showing that the Dogecoin price could rally to $5 by next year. He raised the possibility that DOGE could repeat its macro cycle, which could spark this parabolic run. Bitcoinsensus also noted that the foremost meme coin has been a master of art in geometrical patterns when it comes to its past cycles. Related Reading: Analyst Says Dogecoin Price Is About To Burst, Here‚Äôs The Target This bullish prediction comes despite DOGE‚Äôs underperformance, with the Dogecoin price currently struggling below the psychological $0.2 level. However, this bearish sentiment could change soon, as the crypto market, led by Bitcoin, is once again looking to rebound. This rebound follows the U.S. Senate‚Äôs move to end the government shutdown that has lasted for just over 40 days. Amid the crypto rebound, crypto analyst Chandler has declared that a Dogecoin price rally to $0.30 is closer than it appears. He had earlier stated that a move back to $0.30 this month or in early November was ‚Äúcoded‚Äù as DOGE has been making higher lows since April‚Äôs bottom, with each move preceded by a bullish divergence. Crypto analyst Trader Tardigrade also indicated that a breakout may be imminent for the Dogecoin price. He revealed that DOGE had formed an inverse Head and Shoulders pattern on the 4-hour chart, with the right shoulder formed successfully. The meme coin is now attempting to break the pattern as it looks to reclaim the $0.2 level, which could spark a larger rebound. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt Underestimate DOGE‚Äù Crypto analyst EtherNasyonaL remarked that DOGE should not be underestimated, as he expects the Dogecoin price to still pull off a parabolic rally in this market cycle. The analyst noted that the Dogecoin cyclical nature is quietly retracing its pattern. He added that, as with the first two major price movements in the previous cycles, the foundations for the third major price movement have already been laid. Related Reading: Here‚Äôs Why The Dogecoin And Shiba Inu Prices Are Down The analyst‚Äôs accompanying chart showed that the Dogecoin price could at least rally to $1, which would still mark a new ATH for the foremost meme coin. Crypto analyst Mojo stated that DOGE holding above $0.18 looks good for a rebound and that a break above $0.23 could start the next move up. The short-term target is $0.2, while $0.57 and $1 are the swing and long-term targets, respectively. At the time of writing, the Dogecoin price is trading at around $0.18, up over 4% in the last 24 hours, according to data from CoinMarketCap. Featured image from Getty Images, chart from Tradingview.com

title: Trump-linked crypto projects surge up to 30% in a day
body: Trump-linked crypto projects are all rallying as the US Senate advanced a bipartisan plan to end the longest government shutdown in history. The WLFI token leads the rally with a 33% surge, followed by the $MELANIA memecoin and $TRUMP memecoin with a 13% and 12% surge, respectively, in the last 1 week. The government shutdown, which put nearly 900,000 federal workers on leave, also halted important services, including SNAP food aid and airport operations. Congress failed to pass a budget due to disagreements over extending tax credits under the Affordable Care Act. As reported by Cryptopolitan, after 40 days of gridlock at the federal level, the Senate made a 60‚Äì40 vote, and just hours after, Democrats decided to back a package that would fund some agencies through the end of the fiscal year and others until January 30, 2026. According to reports, POTUS also told reporters at a football game on Sunday night that it looks like the shutdown will end soon. Trump-linked crypto projects surge up to 30% in a day In 2025, coins tied to Trump became one of the most noteworthy stories in crypto. They had lots of political celebrity endorsements, the fast-paced world of Solana memecoins, and a supply design that made it hard to get at first. For $TRUMP, only about 200 million tokens are in circulation, while the maximum supply sits at one billion. On the other hand, World Liberty Financial released 20% of its token supply on Sept. 1, making WLFI tradable on major centralized exchanges. WLFI token launch profits have also declined sharply. The WLFI market launched in September and briefly added $5 billion to its holdings. However, more than half of that value was wiped out within the first week of trading. Also, POTUS‚Äôs crypto portfolio, particularly the donated portion, has now reached an all-time low, dropping below $1 million for the first time. The sharp drop halved DJT‚Äôs WLFI portfolio, which had been valued at over $6 billion. At its current price, Trump‚Äôs WLFI holdings are valued at $1.25 billion, down from $2.5 billion at the end of September. Meanwhile, the WLFI token is trading at approximately $0.1617, representing a 32% surge in the last 24 hours. This is still below the recent all-time high of $0.336, reached within its first week of launch. On the other hand, $TRUMP is trading at $8.69, a 15% surge in the last 24 hours. The wife‚Äôs coin, $MELANIA, is trading at 0.1294, representing a 14% surge in the last 24 hours. Trump‚Äôs crypto business amasses more than $1 billion According to analysts, the key driver behind the surge is POTUS‚Äôs announcement of a $ 2,000‚Ä≥ tariffs dividend‚Äù handout to every American. This has naturally attracted attention to Trump-backed projects again.‚Äù Source: Truth Social Trump said on Truth Socia l on Sunday that he might give everyone in the US a $2,000 dividend paid for by tariff earnings, except people with very high incomes. However, Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent lowered optimism when he said that the dividend might be just the tax decreases that are being seen on the president‚Äôs agenda. Trump‚Äôs crypto business has generated over $1 billion. Last month, his son Eric confirmed that the amount could be more than that. Meanwhile, Democrats are still concerned about Trump‚Äôs ethics because of his involvement in crypto. They point to his family‚Äôs DeFi project, a $2 billion deal with the UAE, and his pardon of Binance founder Changpeng Zhao as examples of clear conflicts of interest. To that end, investors are concerned that once Trump is out of the Oval Office, these coins will be a tale once told. The smartest crypto minds already read our newsletter. Want in? Join them .

title: Why you should care about Web3 domains for your crypto address
body: If you‚Äôve ever tried to send crypto and double-checked a 40-character wallet address five times before hitting ‚Äúsend,‚Äù you already know the problem. Crypto addresses are lengthy, difficult to understand, and prone to typos. This has prevented cryptocurrency from being as user-friendly as it ought to be for years. Are you sick of the lengthy, weird character strings that show in your cryptocurrency wallet? Good news! You can finally get rid of the randomness and use something easy to remember, thanks to the collaboration between Freename and Bitcoin.com. Now, you can pick a name that accurately captures who you are! This is a significant step in ensuring that cryptocurrency is available to anyone. Cryptocurrency can now be sent and received much like an email. A straightforward, human-friendly name for your wallet is entered, saving you the trouble of copying and verifying complex addresses. Simplicity is the key in knowing how to choose a Web3 domain . Consider what is unique to you, memorable, and meaningful. What does the announcement tell us? Here are some of the key take‚Äëaways from the press release: Freename partnered with Bitcoin.com Wallet to bring native Web3 domain resolution to more than 75‚ÄØmillion wallet users. They launched a new TLD: ‚Äú.sat‚Äù, inspired by the smallest unit of Bitcoin (a satoshi). Owning a ‚Äúyourname.sat‚Äù means your Bitcoin identity is your chosen handle. The integration is designed to work natively within the wallet on mobile‚Äîno browser extension, no plug‚Äëin required. Freename also supports more traditional Web2 domains (like .com, .ai, .xyz) being used ‚Äúon‚Äëchain‚Äù for crypto payments and wallet resolution. From this, we can draw guidance on how to choose a Web3 domain and what makes a TLD (top‚Äëlevel domain) ‚Äúbest‚Äù for a crypto address. What makes a ‚Äúbest‚Äù TLD for a crypto address? When thinking about the top‚Äëlevel domain part of your Web3 domain (for example, the ‚Äú.sat‚Äù in yourname.sat), you should evaluate based on several criteria. Below are the major ones: Relevance to crypto / blockchain identityA TLD that signals ‚Äúthis is my crypto handle‚Äù is helpful. For example, .sat has a strong link to Bitcoin (sat‚Äëoshi). That relevance helps when someone sees your domain and recognises it means ‚Äúsend crypto here‚Äù. So when you ask how to choose a Web3 domain, pick a TLD that aligns with your use case: Bitcoin‚Äëcentric, or multi‚Äëchain, or brand/identity. Ease of recognition and memorabilityThe simpler and shorter the TLD, the more people will remember it. Using something like .sat is catchy. If you pick a long or obscure TLD (like .blockchainwallet123), you lose part of the benefit. So in selecting how to choose a Web3 domain, you should prioritise memorability. Wallet / ecosystem integrationIt‚Äôs not enough to own the domain: the wallet or platform you use must recognise and resolve it. In the Freename + Bitcoin.com case, the integration is native: you type ‚Äúalice.sat‚Äù in the send field, and the wallet resolves it. If you pick a TLD that isn‚Äôt widely supported, you might lose that convenience. So when considering how to choose a Web3 domain, check ecosystem support. Security and long‚Äëterm stabilityA TLD backed by a credible registrar or a large ecosystem is more likely to remain functional, supported and secure. For example, Freename is ICANN‚Äëaccredited and has launched these new TLDs. When you think how to choose a Web3 domain, include trustworthiness. Flexibility of use beyond crypto paymentsSome Web3 domains and TLDs enable more than just wallet addresses‚Äîthey can work for websites, email identities, payments, multiple chains. The press release mentions that domains can connect to websites, payments, email. If you anticipate doing more than sending/receiving crypto (e.g., building a web identity, receiving donations), consider a TLD with that capability. Cost and renewal considerationsSome TLDs are premium or expensive to register or renew. When you ask how to choose a Web3 domain, you should factor in ongoing cost. The announcement suggests promotions and discounts but future cost may vary. Availability and uniquenessJust like web domains, you want something unique but also available. If the TLD is popular, many names will already be taken. So when figuring how to choose a Web3 domain, evaluate both the TLD and your desired name within it. Top candidate TLDs for crypto addresses Based on the above criteria and the current market/announcement, here are some of the best TLDs to consider for a crypto address: .sat ‚Äì This is the TLD from Freename/Bitcoin.com, clearly oriented to Bitcoin use. Because it is new, you may have more chances to pick a short name. Good integration, relevant branding, native wallet support. This makes .sat a strong contender when thinking how to choose a Web3 domain. .crypto, .wallet, .eth, .btc ‚Äì These are more generic Web3‚Äëoriented TLDs (or domain namespaces) that have been around. If your use is multi‚Äëchain or you want recognition outside of Bitcoin alone, a broader one may help. .com / .ai / .xyz ‚Äì Traditional Web2 TLDs but here repurposed for Web3 use (via Freename‚Äôs ‚Äúblockchain‚Äëmirroring‚Äù tech). If you already have a brand with ‚Äú.com‚Äù, then turning that into your wallet domain may help brand consistency. The trade‚Äëoff: maybe less ‚Äúcrypto‚Äëspecific‚Äù signalling. So when thinking how to choose a Web3 domain, if branding matters, a traditional TLD may win. Brand‚Äëspecific or niche TLDs ‚Äì Some platforms allow creation of custom TLDs or less common ones. If you have a niche community or brand, you might pick a specialized TLD. But the risk: lesser recognition and potentially weaker ecosystem support. Step‚Äëby‚Äëstep: How to choose a Web3 domain Putting it all together, here‚Äôs a practical guide: Define your use caseAre you using this as a personal wallet address (for Bitcoin, Ethereum, multi‚Äëchain)? Are you using it for your brand? Are you building a website + wallet + identity? Clarifying the use case helps narrow which TLD fits best. Shortlist your desired handleThink of a simple name: your name, your brand, your nickname. Make it readable, easy to type, easy to say. Then pair it with candidate TLDs (e.g., yourname.sat, yourname.crypto, yourbrand.com). This step is central in how to choose a Web3 domain. Evaluate TLD options via the criteria above Does the TLD signal crypto/identity clearly? Is it widely supported in wallets, platforms, browsers (native resolution)? Is it secure, backed by credible registrar? Does it allow you future flexibility (website, email, url) beyond wallet addresses? What is the cost and renewal schedule? Is your chosen name still available under the TLD?These are essential when deciding how to choose a Web3 domain. Check ecosystem integrationFor example: the ‚Äú.sat‚Äù TLD is integrated with Bitcoin.com Wallet. See how your wallet or platform recognises the domain. Confirm that you can type ‚Äúyourname.sat‚Äù (or whatever) and send funds without additional plug‚Äëins. This ensures your domain will function as intended. Branding & recognitionEven though the domain is meant for wallet addresses, it will likely be shared, printed, put on business cards, etc. Choose a TLD that aligns with your identity. If you‚Äôre in the crypto space , a crypto‚Äëspecific TLD signals ‚Äúthis is my wallet‚Äù. If you‚Äôre a more general brand, a .com may feel more familiar. In how to choose a Web3 domain, branding is often under‚Äëconsidered. Lock in your registration and configure your domainOnce you pick, register it through a trusted registrar (like Freename). Map the domain to your wallet address, set up resolution. Configure any additional features (website, email, alias). Then test: send a small amount to the domain, confirm it resolves to your wallet. This is the operational side of how to choose a Web3 domain: make sure it actually works. Maintain and secure your domainTreat this domain as you would a wallet: apply security best practices (strong registrar account security, two‚Äëfactor authentication, monitor renewals). Because your domain is your identity, losing it or having it compromised can cause harm. So when you select how to choose a Web3 domain, security and maintenance are essential. Final thoughts There is no one ‚Äúperfect‚Äù TLD that fits everyone. The best TLD depends on your specific goals, audience, and ecosystem. But based on the emerging trend and current infrastructure, .sat stands out as a strong candidate for Bitcoin‚Äëfocused users because of its native integration, relevance, and backing by major players (Freename + Bitcoin.com). If you‚Äôre operating more broadly or building a brand beyond crypto, a more traditional TLD repurposed for Web3 use might be right for you. When you ask how to choose a Web3 domain, remember that the domain is more than just a wallet alias‚Äîit becomes part of your identity, your brand, your digital presence. Pick a TLD that fits your identity, ensures usability for your audience, and is supported by ecosystem infrastructure. Use the criteria above‚Äîrelevance, recognition, integration, security, flexibility, cost‚Äîto guide you. As crypto and Web3 adoption continues, human‚Äëreadable domains will become ever more mainstream. The days of copy‚Äëpasting 40‚Äëcharacter wallet strings are numbered. By choosing your Web3 domain wisely now, you position yourself for smoother interactions, better identity control, and a more professional presence. For those in the crypto space and beyond: take a moment, go through the steps above, and pick the domain that best aligns with your future. And if you‚Äôre ready, consider registering the TLD, configuring it, and testing it so you‚Äôre ahead of the curve rather than scrambling later. title: Transforming Crypto Transactions: The Rise of Web3 Domains
body: For those familiar with the complexities of cryptocurrency transactions, the stress of handling long, convoluted wallet addresses is all too common. However, with the advent of Web3 domains through the partnership between Freename and Bitcoin.com, this cumbersome process is poised for a significant overhaul. Web3 domains replace the traditional, error-prone numeric and character-heavy wallet addresses with simple, memorable names. This evolution not only simplifies transactions significantly but also enhances security and reduces the chances of costly errors. Here, we dive into the world of Web3 domains, exploring their benefits, how they work, and why they represent a critical development in the cryptocurrency landscape. Introduction to Web3 Domains Web3 domains function similarly to email addresses in the realm of cryptocurrency. Instead of using a string of numbers and letters, you can send or receive crypto through an easy-to-remember name. This change is akin to moving from a complex set of numerical IP addresses to simple domain names in the early days of the internet. The initiative by Freename to introduce the ".sat" top-level domain (TLD), inspired by 'satoshi', the smallest unit of Bitcoin, exemplifies this transition. By collaborating with Bitcoin.com, Freename has brought Web3 domain resolution to over 75 million wallet users, facilitating a more user-friendly approach to cryptocurrency management. This strategic partnership allows for native resolution of these domains directly within the Bitcoin.com Wallet, eliminating the need for additional plugins or extensions. Choosing the Right Web3 Domain Deciding on the right Web3 domain involves several considerations. The choice of a domain should reflect your personal or business identity, be easily memorable, and align with your cryptocurrency activities. Here's a deeper look into how to select a TLD that best suits your needs: Relevance: Choose a TLD that relates directly to your crypto activities. For instance, ".sat" is intrinsically linked to Bitcoin. Memorability: A straightforward and short TLD will be easier for others to recall and use in transactions. Ecosystem Support: Ensure that the TLD you choose is supported by major wallets and platforms for seamless integration. Understanding these fundamentals can significantly enhance your ability to select the most appropriate Web3 domain. For a comprehensive guide on this process, learn how to choose a Web3 domain . Why It Matters The shift to human-readable Web3 domains is not just a convenience but a necessity as the digital currency landscape expands and becomes more integrated into daily financial activities. The ability to easily communicate where to send and receive funds without error is a major advancement in making cryptocurrency accessible to a broader audience. As we continue to witness the growth of digital wallets and the use of cryptocurrency in a wider array of transactions, embracing innovations like Web3 domains will be vital. They not only streamline processes but also enhance the user experience, making it comparable to traditional financial transactions. For additional insights into the workings of cryptocurrency and its underlying technologies, consider exploring further through educational resources on how cryptocurrency works . Conclusion The integration of Web3 domains into the cryptocurrency ecosystem marks a significant milestone towards simplifying digital transactions. By adopting a Web3 domain, users can ensure greater ease of use, improved security, and a reduction in potential errors. As the digital landscape evolves, staying informed and adaptable to new technologies like Web3 domains will be key to navigating the future of cryptocurrency effectively. title: Technical Analyst: XRP‚ÄØIs‚ÄØGearing‚ÄØUp‚ÄØfor‚ÄØa‚ÄØMajor‚ÄØLeg‚ÄëUp.‚ÄØHere‚Äôs‚ÄØwhy
body: The crypto market offers few setups as compelling as the one currently forming around XRP. After years of consolidation and regulatory flux, the coin appears to be quietly positioning for a meaningful move upward. According to chart‚Äëspecialist ChartNerd, the setup is no mere drift‚Äîit may be a launchpad for a major leg‚Äëup in value. Multi‚ÄëYear Reaccumulation Phase ChartNerd identifies a long base forming for XRP. He notes that, on a log‚Äëscale chart, XRP has traded between approximately‚ÄØ$1 and around‚ÄØ$3 (its 2017 peak) for a protracted period. In his view, this range has served as a reaccumulation zone‚Äîwhere smart money can build positions quietly. The price action‚Äôs prolonged idle phase suggests the groundwork is being laid for what could be a breakout. $XRP is gearing up for a major leg-up. https://t.co/iBfCZPIk6a pic.twitter.com/0aBupcGERQ ‚Äî ChartNerd (@ChartNerdTA) November 9, 2025 Resistances, Trigger, and Breakout Mechanics The linchpin of the thesis is a breakout above the $3 ceiling. ChartNerd emphasizes that once XRP breaches this resistance with conviction‚Äîideally accompanied by volume and institutional engagement‚Äîthe setup shifts from accumulation to launch mode. He further argues that market conditions are aligning: regulatory clarity is improving, ecosystem developments around the Ripple Labs‚Äëdriven XRPL universe are maturing, and investor sentiment is tilting bullish . These factors, combined with the technical base, could spark the move. XRP Price Target & Upside Implications Should the breakout validate, ChartNerd posits a target in the region of $12.50 for XRP . This target springs from the log‚Äëscale geometry of the base and the magnitude of prior consolidation. In practical terms, such a move would multiply current levels several‚Äëfold. While the target isn‚Äôt guaranteed, the risk‚Äëreward profile from this formation appears attractive‚Äîespecially given the well‚Äëdefined base and resistance. We are on X, follow us to connect with us :- @TimesTabloid1 ‚Äî TimesTabloid (@TimesTabloid1) June 15, 2025 Risk Controls & Market Context That said, readers should remain grounded. Extended bases can unravel if the breakout fails or if macro conditions deteriorate. For XRP, regulatory clarity remains a variable‚Äîeven though meaningful progress has been achieved. Nonetheless, from a structure‚Äëand‚Äëmarket macro perspective, the current price band offers a relatively defined risk zone. Support near the bottom of the base limits downside, while a breakout could unlock large upside. In the broader crypto market‚Äîcharacterized by renewed institutional interest and more robust infrastructure‚Äîthe timing appears favorable. In summary, ChartNerd‚Äôs analysis presents a crisp narrative: XRP may be transitioning out of a long consolidation , and the breakout above $3 could trigger a leg‚Äëup toward $12.50. For traders and long‚Äëterm holders alike, the message is clear: watch for confirmation of the breakout, define your risk zones, and prepare for the possibility of outsized reward. As always, conduct your own due diligence and align exposure to your individual risk tolerance. Disclaimer: This content is meant to inform and should not be considered financial advice. title: Bitcoin Price Prediction 2026‚Äì2027: BTC Could Hit $260K by 2027 for a 140% Gain‚ÄîBut Ozak AI Could Deliver 700√ó ROI in the Same Period
body: Bitcoin (BTC) continues to dominate the cryptocurrency landscape. As of late October 2025, BTC is trading in the neighbourhood of ‚âà $110,000‚Äì$115,000. For example, on 25 October 2025 the closing price was reported at ~$111,641.73. After briefly touching a record high above $125,000 earlier this month, Bitcoin has entered a consolidation phase. Despite recent fluctuations, the world‚Äôs largest cryptocurrency maintains a market capitalization above $2.1 trillion, reaffirming its position as the top digital asset by value. Analysts suggest the cooling period comes as traders lock in profits and the broader market digests macroeconomic pressures such as a stronger U.S. dollar and mixed signals from global equity markets. Technical Outlook: RSI, MACD, and Key Levels Technical indicators point to a neutral tone in the short term. The RSI stands near 47, showing neither overbought nor oversold conditions. The MACD has flattened, signaling that momentum is stabilizing after a strong upward run earlier in October. The 200-day SMA sits around $110,000, a key support zone. As long as Bitcoin stays above this mark, the broader trend remains bullish. The 50-day SMA near $117,500 acts as the first major resistance to the upside. Immediate support levels are seen around $111,000 and $108,000, while resistance sits near $115,500 and $118,000. A breakout above these levels could open the door for a retest of the $125,000 all-time high, while a drop below $108,000 may trigger a deeper pullback toward $100,000. Why Bitcoin May Rise or Fall Recent weakness has been linked to temporary risk-off sentiment in global markets and profit-taking by large investors. However, long-term fundamentals remain strong. Growing institutional adoption through Bitcoin ETFs, continued accumulation by corporations, and expectations of another halving cycle push optimism for a renewed rally in 2026‚Äì2027. If institutional inflows continue and regulatory clarity improves, analysts believe Bitcoin could reach $260,000 by late 2027, representing a 140 % increase from current prices. This projection assumes a sustained uptrend following the next halving, historically known to trigger multi-year bull markets. Ozak AI: The Rising Star in the Presale Market While Bitcoin‚Äôs long-term potential remains impressive, a new project called Ozak AI is capturing attention for its explosive growth in the presale market. The project integrates artificial intelligence with blockchain technology to provide real-time market analytics, predictive trading insights, and data-driven tools for investors. Ozak AI operates on Arbitrum Orbit, ensuring faster transactions and low fees. It uses Prediction Agents (PAs)‚Äîcustomizable modules that analyze live and historical data to forecast crypto market trends.
